channel.title: Comments on: A Tor of the Dark Web

item.title: By: Counter Globalist
item.dc:creator: Counter Globalist
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/08/a-tor-of-the-dark-web/#comment-227">whatever</a>.
Censorship is imposed on another person via force. Your argument is self defeating. Using force against other humans is wrong.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to whatever.

Censorship is imposed on another person via force.
Your argument is self defeating.
Using force against other humans is wrong.

item.title: By: David Collins
item.dc:creator: David Collins
item.description:
i won't bother defending the virtues of privacy and free trade from mouthbreathers who moralize while supporting the genocide of 'people that like to eat things that make them feel different' and people caught in the crossfire of the cartels born of prohibition. there's no moral argument to be made to someone who doesn't think your life is your own to do with as you wish.
instead i'll just note that said bootlickers have been thoroughly defeated, and that anyone can do anything they want with a little bit of knowledge and TOR, and there is nothing you can do to stop them. see, people who value freedom are more intelligent then you, and you don't have any comparable system you could use to defeat the ones that freedom has created. those who want to be left alone will always be one step ahead of the bootlickers that can't stand people doing business without being taxed or controlled.
item.content:encoded:
i won’t bother defending the virtues of privacy and free trade from mouthbreathers who moralize while supporting the genocide of ‘people that like to eat things that make them feel different’ and people caught in the crossfire of the cartels born of prohibition. there’s no moral argument to be made to someone who doesn’t think your life is your own to do with as you wish.

instead i’ll just note that said bootlickers have been thoroughly defeated, and that anyone can do anything they want with a little bit of knowledge and TOR, and there is nothing you can do to stop them. see, people who value freedom are more intelligent then you, and you don’t have any comparable system you could use to defeat the ones that freedom has created. those who want to be left alone will always be one step ahead of the bootlickers that can’t stand people doing business without being taxed or controlled.

item.title: By: NAME
item.dc:creator: NAME
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/08/a-tor-of-the-dark-web/#comment-228">d p d p d p</a>.
Tor port numbers say "I'm here doing something I shouldn't!" to the feds. Even though they can't see the data they know it's Tor and will then look even more closely.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to d p d p d p.

Tor port numbers say “I’m here doing something I shouldn’t!” to the feds. Even though they can’t see the data they know it’s Tor and will then look even more closely.
